conclusion: Analyze the direction of liquid flows from containers A, B, and C and determine which container they will flow into based on the baffles.
Liquids from containers A, B, and C are shown flowing diagonally down towards the bottom of the image.
Liquid direction is consistent with gravity, suggesting these fluids will flow downward if unobstructed.
Baffles D and E are positioned at the bottom in such a way that they can direct the flow of liquids towards specific containers.
Baffle D is positioned on the left side, and baffle E is on the right side.
Container D is positioned under the yellow, white, and yellow liquids (from A, B, and C respectively) and the liquids will be directed towards container D.
Container E is positioned under the black and black liquid (from B and C respectively) and the liquids will be directed towards container E.
Liquids from A, B, and C will flow into containers D and E depending on their exact position and the alignment of the liquid paths relative to the baffles.
B will flow into both D and E.
Conclusion is based on the visual alignment of the liquid flows with respect to the baffles' positions.
